skill.name: uspto-database
skill.description: Access USPTO APIs for patent/trademark searches, examination history (PEDS), assignments, citations, office actions, TSDR, for IP analysis and prior art searches.
skill.summary: Access USPTO APIs for patent/trademark searches, examination history (PEDS), assignments, citations,...
skill.author: K-Dense-AI

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate USPTO API client for patent and trademark research. Static findings are false positives: detected patterns in markdown files are documentation code examples, not executable code. The network+credential access pattern is standard API client behavior for accessing USPTO government services.

content.value_statement: Access comprehensive USPTO patent and trademark databases. Search by keywords, inventors, or assignees. Retrieve examination history, assignments, citations, and office actions for IP research and prior art searches.
actual_capabilities: Search patents by keywords, inventors, assignees, classifications, and dates using PatentSearch API
Retrieve trademark information and status using TSDR API
Access patent examination history (PEDS) including office actions and transaction history
Track patent and trademark assignments and ownership changes
Analyze patent citations (forward and backward) and office action details
limitations: Requires USPTO API key registration for full functionality
Rate limits apply (45 requests/minute for PatentSearch API)
PatentSearch data currently covers through June 30, 2025

use_cases.title: Prior art searches
use_cases.description: Find prior art and analyze patent citations for patentability opinions and infringement cases.

use_cases.title: Examination history review
use_cases.description: Access full prosecution history including office actions, rejections, and applicant responses.

use_cases.title: Trademark monitoring
use_cases.description: Check trademark status, ownership, and prosecution history for clearance and maintenance.

prompt_templates.title: Basic patent search
prompt_templates.prompt: Search for patents related to [topic] filed in the last 2 years using the uspto-database skill.

prompt_templates.title: Inventor lookup
prompt_templates.prompt: Find all patents filed by [inventor name] using the uspto-database skill and show their current status.

prompt_templates.title: Trademark status
prompt_templates.prompt: Check the status and ownership history of trademark [serial/registration number] using uspto-database.

prompt_templates.title: Full prosecution analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a comprehensive analysis of patent [number] including examination history, office actions, and assignments using uspto-database.

output_examples.input: Search for machine learning patents from Google filed in 2024
output: Patent 11,987,654: Machine learning image recognition system

best_practices: Store your USPTO API key in the USPTO_API_KEY environment variable before use
Implement exponential backoff when hitting rate limits to avoid service disruptions
Use _text_* operators for text searches as they are more performant than _contains
anti_patterns: Do not hardcode API keys in scripts or share them in version control
Do not exceed the 45 requests/minute rate limit for PatentSearch API
Do not assume all fields are populated for every patent or trademark record

faq.question: How do I get a USPTO API key?
faq.answer: Register at https://account.uspto.gov/api-manager/ for USPTO APIs or https://patentsview.org/api-v01-information-page for PatentSearch API.

faq.question: What data does PatentSearch cover?
faq.answer: PatentSearch contains patent data through June 30, 2025. For older data or examination history, use PEDS.

faq.question: Can I search trademarks by name?
faq.answer: Trademark search requires serial or registration number. Use TSDR for status and prosecution history by number.

faq.question: What is PEDS?
faq.answer: PEDS (Patent Examination Data System) provides prosecution history including office actions, transactions, and status changes from 1981-present.

faq.question: How many requests can I make?
faq.answer: PatentSearch has a 45 requests/minute rate limit. Implement backoff for rate limit errors.

faq.question: Can I analyze patent citations?
faq.answer: Yes, use the Enriched Citation API documented in references/additional_apis.md for forward and backward citation analysis.
